channel.title: Special Moments in Games
channel.description:
We all have had them, the special moments in gaming. These includes anything, such as beating Nihilanth in Half-Life to finally get that specific weapon in Modern Warfare. It may be nostalgic or anything that makes you pissed at the game and you will always remember it for that reason. So what can you remember which was special for [b][i]you[/i][/b]? [COLOR='Red']This thread may include spoilers. [/SIZE] There you have it :wink:
I have a couple which includes :
[i][b]Super Mario Galaxy[/b][/i] - Bowser's Star Reactor, hearing this awesome tune of Koopa's Road from Super Mario 64 gave me a tear.
[i][b]The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess[/b][/i] - When you first enter Temple of Time and hear the classic tune from Ocarina of Time. Satisfying!
[i][b]Super Ghouls and Ghosts[/b][/i] - When you finally complete all the levels and are at the doorstep to the final boss : "Go back and get the sheild/amulet(Can't remember what it was)". And you have to start all over again...I was sooooo pissed at the game and have never played it since then. Damn you Capcom for making such a hard game!!
[i][b]Secret of Mana[/b][/i] - When the game is closing in and you defeat the final boss, you never had a chance to say goodbye to the Sprite child. A little sad, but I still remember it.
[i][b]F-Zero GX[/b][/i] - When you finally complete the Final Mission on Story Mode, Falcon takes his helmet off... and credits starts to roll...Was that it? Pissed me off a little.
[b][i]Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots[/i][/b] - The Return to Shadow Moses Island, when you first enter the Heliport and "The Best Is Yet To Come" starts play. Such an epic moment for me.
[i][b]God of War 3 [/b][/i]- The Ending, when Kratos takes suicide. I was left confused and a little sad. Such an epic game and a "What the..." ending.
[i][b]Gears of War 2[/b][/i] - The "Final Boss" Battle, this was somewhat a disappointment, such a great game with such an easy "Final Boss"

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: mini_bunney
item.description:
Mass Effect 2: meeting Thane for the first time, actually

EDIT: scratch that, most epic moment in ME2 was starting up the game not actually knowing what to expect, never having played such a game before, playing for a bit and suddenly stumbling out of a door into space. The scenery was just breathtaking.

Read full topic

item.description:
Blowing up Megaton at night in fallout 3

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: chrish4161
item.description:
Actually I have two such moment in my game life. The first is from NFS most wanted. When I get BMW M3 GTR car at the first race reward. My friend told me I am lucky because the whole game is to get this car and I got it at the first round. And the another moment is I complete whole IGI-2 in one sitting and I feel like a solder.

Read full topic

item.description:

Half-Life 2: Episode 1-Seeing zombine for first time.
Half-Life 2: Episode 2-Death of Eli.

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: _amp_955_dam
item.description:
Personal preferences, Firetime. Personal preferences… :3

However, even though it was only a trailer, the Croft Manor being blown up in the Tomb Raider Underworld Trailer was purely awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
λdam:

… especially the part where you brother gets killed…

no

That was the most half-assed horrible intro to a game ever. The game was fun to play but the story… I only have two words do that games story line. Wasted potential.

danielsangeo:

…I loved Conker’s all the way up until the end…and then when it got serious, I suddenly didn’t like the game any more and it ruined the entire game for me. It was like Old Yeller for me.

I know the feeling. As I said I wasent sure if it was the worst or best ending ever. Bit one thigs positive because of it it totally was a downer ending that required the player to freek out and want more. Makes me so mad that when Microsoft bought out rare they canceled the development of CBFD2. Rare publicly stated that if microsoft gave them the go ahead they would be all over it.

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Just Cause 2: Jumping out of a helicopter about to explode only to find ten Elites in front of you, realizing that you are about to die, then having the helicopter fall on the elites. Freakin’ awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: _amp_955_dam
item.description:
Eli’s death in Half Life 2: Episode 2.

Mirrors Edge ending. Saving your sister.

Red Faction Guerilla had some pretty special moments as well, especially the part where you brother gets killed, and you smash that EDF Soldier in the face.

The ending to Assassins Creed II was a bit of a mind boggler, but awesome anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
FireTime: I loved Conker’s all the way up until the end…and then when it got serious, I suddenly didn’t like the game any more and it ruined the entire game for me. It was like Old Yeller for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
the very first and last scene in conker’s bad fur day. I wasn’t sure it it was horrible or amazing when I first saw it. A game that was so humorous all of a sudden gets dark and serious. Making a perfect extension of the opening, completely tricking the player on the emotions that they thought they were perceiving.

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: Deadline99
item.description:
Mith:

Killing Diablo for the first time in the original game after dying thousands of times.

Then killing him again in the second game.

And a reserved spot here for killing that horned motherfucker in the third game, if he ever shows up in it.

When is that game ever gonna come out? kinda reminds me of something…:retard:

Read full topic

Ahh I see ;3

I don’t remember there being a dog in Twilight Princess that you could pick up, in what part of the game was it?

Hyrule Castle Town, Ordon Village. You can pick up puppies, but you can’t throw them :[

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: SoaringScout
item.description:
Legend of Zelda: Twilght Princess- Picking up a dog
Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker- Picking up a morbidly obese pig
Just Cause 2- u[/u]Finally getting a frame rate of about 60 fps during the final mission when fighting Baby Panay for the last time
Counter-Strike: Source- Having your player model stand like a scarecrow with his gun coming from the WRONG PART OF HIS BODY.

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Fuck yeah, I fucking loved that first underground lab. Scared the crap out of me, the atmosphere was amazing!

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl* First underground lab, seeing a box lift off the ground with nothing around.[indent]Man that was exciting. I retreated full-sprint for 20 seconds and camped the stairs for 80 more. Gunning down the first poltergeist was overwhelmingly satisfying, those invisible bastards suddenly became mortal.[/indent]

  • Having a bloodsucker pop up behind you for the first time.[indent]Somewhere on the surface unexpectedly… those things are the devil.[/indent]

Read full topic

item.title: Special Moments in Games
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
taxi_evil:

Oh, and of course Gman’s heart to heart from Episode 2

“Dr Freeman…”

I completely wasn’t expecting that

That’s one of the greatest speeches in video game history!
